January.title: Winter's Tale
January.author: Mark Helprin
January.synopsis: A magical and romantic tale set in a fantastical version of New York City, exploring themes of love, destiny, and time.

January.title: The Snow Child
January.author: Eowyn Ivey
January.synopsis: A poignant story about a childless couple in Alaska who mysteriously encounter a young girl seemingly made of snow.

January.title: Arctic Dreams
January.author: Barry Lopez
January.synopsis: An evocative exploration of the Arctic landscape, its wildlife, and its deep connection to the human spirit.

February.title: Love in the Time of Cholera
February.author: Gabriel García Márquez
February.synopsis: A sweeping tale of unrequited love and devotion spanning over fifty years, set in a Caribbean seaport town.

February.title: The Rosie Project
February.author: Graeme Simsion
February.synopsis: A charming romantic comedy about a socially awkward genetics professor searching for a wife using a scientific method.

February.title: Me Before You
February.author: Jojo Moyes
February.synopsis: A heart-wrenching love story between a caregiver and her paralyzed patient that challenges the limits of love and sacrifice.

March.title: Spring Fever
March.author: Mary Kay Andrews
March.synopsis: A delightful Southern romance about second chances and uncovering family secrets during the springtime.

March.title: The Secret Garden
March.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
March.synopsis: A classic story of a neglected orphan who discovers a hidden, magical garden that transforms her life and those around her.

March.title: The Night Circus
March.author: Erin Morgenstern
March.synopsis: A mesmerizing tale of a magical circus that appears without warning and a love story between two rival magicians.

April.title: Rainwater
April.author: Sandra Brown
April.synopsis: Set during the Great Depression, this poignant story follows a widow who opens her boarding house to a mysterious stranger.

April.title: April Lady
April.author: Georgette Heyer
April.synopsis: A Regency romance about a young bride navigating misunderstandings and rediscovering love with her husband.

April.title: The Paris Library
April.author: Janet Skeslien Charles
April.synopsis: A historical novel about the brave librarians of the American Library in Paris during WWII and the bonds they forge.

May.title: The Forgotten Garden
May.author: Kate Morton
May.synopsis: A spellbinding tale of a woman's search for her true identity, spanning continents and generations.

May.title: A Year in Provence
May.author: Peter Mayle
May.synopsis: A delightful memoir about an English couple adjusting to life in the French countryside, filled with humor and charm.

May.title: The Overstory
May.author: Richard Powers
May.synopsis: An intricate and moving novel about the power and interconnectedness of trees and their impact on human lives.

June.title: Summer Sisters
June.author: Judy Blume
June.synopsis: A coming-of-age tale of friendship, betrayal, and love set against idyllic summer backdrops.

June.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
June.author: William Shakespeare
June.synopsis: A comedic tale of love, magic, and misunderstandings set in an enchanted forest.

June.title: The Summer House
June.author: Lauren K. Denton
June.synopsis: A heartwarming story about rebuilding one's life, finding love, and embracing community.

July.title: The Summer I Turned Pretty
July.author: Jenny Han
July.synopsis: A romantic YA story about summer love, heartbreak, and self-discovery at a beachside getaway.

July.title: Beach Read
July.author: Emily Henry
July.synopsis: A delightful rom-com about two rival authors spending a summer challenging each other to write outside their genres.

July.title: The Vacationers
July.author: Emma Straub
July.synopsis: A witty and heartwarming story of a family vacation in Mallorca that unravels secrets and strengthens bonds.

August.title: Hot August Nights
August.author: Neil Diamond
August.synopsis: A thrilling novel capturing the heat and drama of a music-fueled summer night.

August.title: A Tale for the Time Being
August.author: Ruth Ozeki
August.synopsis: A poignant exploration of time, connection, and the ties between a Japanese teenager and a writer in Canada.

August.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
August.author: Delia Owens
August.synopsis: A captivating mystery about an isolated girl who becomes a suspect in a murder case.

September.title: Educated
September.author: Tara Westover
September.synopsis: A memoir about a young woman's journey from growing up in a strict, survivalist family to earning a PhD.

September.title: The September Society
September.author: Charles Finch
September.synopsis: A Victorian mystery involving an exclusive club and a detective's relentless pursuit of the truth.

September.title: The Book Thief
September.author: Markus Zusak
September.synopsis: A hauntingly beautiful story of a young girl who steals books in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death itself.

October.title: Frankenstein
October.author: Mary Shelley
October.synopsis: A Gothic classic exploring the perils of playing God through the tale of Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.

October.title: Dracula
October.author: Bram Stoker
October.synopsis: The quintessential vampire novel that set the stage for countless tales of gothic horror.

October.title: The Haunting of Hill House
October.author: Shirley Jackson
October.synopsis: A chilling tale of a haunted house and the psychological unraveling of its inhabitants.

November.title: The Harvest
November.author: H. W. Brands
November.synopsis: A historical account of the agricultural transformations shaping America's identity.

November.title: Pilgrim's Progress
November.author: John Bunyan
November.synopsis: A Christian allegory chronicling a man's journey to faith and salvation.

November.title: The Giving Tree
November.author: Shel Silverstein
November.synopsis: A timeless parable about love, selflessness, and the bond between a boy and a tree.

December.title: A Christmas Carol
December.author: Charles Dickens
December.synopsis: A classic tale of redemption as Ebenezer Scrooge transforms from a miser to a kind-hearted man on Christmas Eve.

December.title: Little Women
December.author: Louisa May Alcott
December.synopsis: The enduring story of the March sisters navigating love, loss, and personal growth.

December.title: The Polar Express
December.author: Chris Van Allsburg
December.synopsis: A magical Christmas adventure as a boy boards a train to the North Pole.
